isis.stitle: TSI 93-03-01 - Convert International 17,500 Pound 4x2 Rear Air Suspension (Codes 03SAD, 03SAM, and 03SAK) to International 12,000 Pound 4x2 Rear Air Suspension (Codes 03SAS and 03SAT)

subjectgroup.subject: Convert International 17,500 Pound 4x2 Rear Air Suspension (Codes 03SAD, 03SAM, and 03SAK) to International 12,000 Pound 4x2 Rear Air Suspension (Codes 03SAS and 03SAT)

geninfo.para: In emergency vehicle applications, International customers with 4600LP and 4700LP 4x2 vehicles that have an International 17,500 pound capacity rear air suspension (Codes 03SAD, 03SAM or 03SAK) may find this suspension has excess capacity relative to actual loading. International now has a 12,000 pound 4x2 rear air suspension (Codes 03SAS for use with air brakes, or 03SAT for use with hydraulic brakes). The 17,500 pound (Codes 03SAD, 03SAM or 03SAK) rear 4x2 suspensions can be converted to the lower capacity system to reduce ride harshness.

The following procedure is for converting an International 4x2, 17,500 pound rear air suspension (Codes 03SAD, 03SAM or 03SAK) on a 4600LP or 4700LP 4x2 to an International 12,000 pound rear 4x2 air suspension (Codes 03SAS or 03SAT).

svcproc.stitle: TSI 93-03-01 - Convert International 17,500 Pound 4x2 Rear Air Suspension (Codes 03SAD, 03SAM, and 03SAK) to International 12,000 Pound 4x2 Rear Air Suspension (Codes 03SAS and 03SAT)
svcproc.title: REMOVAL
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 1for component reference for the following steps unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Block wheels to prevent vehicle from moving.
From the frame, jack up the rear of the vehicle enough to unload the air springs, but not enough to lift the rear wheels of the vehicle off the floor.
Support the vehicle on floor stands far enough back on the frame rails to allow enough room to work on the suspension.

warning.para: Jack(s) must never be used alone to support a vehicle while under-chassis service is being performed. The jack(s) may lower and serious personal injury or death could result. ALWAYS SUPPORT THE VEHICLE WITH FLOOR STANDS.

step1.para: Exhaust all the air from the vehicle. Loosen an air line fitting at one of the air springs to ensure that all the air has been exhausted.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury from excessive air pressure, be sure all the air pressure is bled off the air system before removing any air lines or air operated component(s).

step1.para: After all the air pressure has been bled off, remove the air lines from both air springs.
Disconnect the height control valve vertical linkage anchor from the crossmember.
Disconnect both shock absorbers from the shock absorber lower mounting brackets.
Unbolt both air springs from the side of the frame rails.
Unbolt the crossmember from both the left and right tapered leaf spring, and remove the crossmember and air springs as a single unit.

Remove the air springs, air spring plates and shock absorber mounting brackets from the crossmember. Set aside the air springs and the crossmember; the air spring plates and shock absorber mounting brackets will be reused on the new air spring installation.

svcproc.stitle: TSI 93-03-01 - Convert International 17,500 Pound 4x2 Rear Air Suspension (Codes 03SAD, 03SAM, and 03SAK) to International 12,000 Pound 4x2 Rear Air Suspension (Codes 03SAS and 03SAT)
svcproc.title: INSTALLATION

step1.para: The air spring plates need an additional hole to mount the new air springs to. Use Figure 2to locate where to drill that hole in both air spring plates.

After the hole has been drilled in both air spring plates, mount the new air springs and plates to the new crossmember. Air line fittings on the air springs should be positioned outboard of the frame rail.
Mount crossmember with air springs attached, to the left and right tapered leaf springs. Mount the crossmember so its open center is facing the back of the vehicle.

Mount both shock absorber lower mounting brackets to the crossmember as illustrated in Figure 1. Mount the lower end of the shock absorbers to the brackets. Tighten the shock absorber mounting nuts to 135-165 ft-lbs (183-224 Nm).

Fasten the top of the air springs to the side of the frame rails as illustrated in Figure 3. It may be necessary to jack up on the crossmember to line up the mounting holes with the frame holes. Tighten the mounting bolts to 110-120 ft-lbs. (89-101 Nm).
Air lines from the leveling valve to the air springs will have to be routed on the outside of the frame and may have to be lengthened.
Install the height control valve vertical linkage anchor in the hole provided in the new crossmember.
Remove the floor stands. Start the vehicle and build up air pressure to set the new air springs. Check for air leaks, repair as required.
Check the air spring height.

svcproc.title: CHECK AIR SPRING HEIGHT

step1.para: Place a straight edge on the centerline of the top plate on the air springs. Measure the distance between the top of the crossmember and the bottom of the straight edge. This distance is the air spring height (Item 2, Figure 4).
If the spring height is not 12 ± 0.25 inches, refer to GROUP 03 - SPRINGS, CTS-5025, for the procedure to set the air spring height.
